yage.core.misc

Authors:
Eric Poggel

License:
LGPL

Miscellaneous core types, functions, and templates that have no other place.

union word;
Allow for easy bool-by-bool conversion from one two-byte type to another.

Example:
 short a;
 word w;
 w.s = a;
 char c = w.c[1];	// c is the second byte of a.


short s;
ushort us;
byte[2] b;
ubyte[2] ub;
char[2] c;
Union of various types.

static word opApply(ushort us);
Convert ushort to word

struct dword;
Allow for easy bool-by-bool conversion from one four-byte type to another

int i;
uint ui;
float f;
short[2] s;
ushort[2] us;
byte[4] b;
ubyte[4] ub;
char[4] c;
Union of various types.

static dword opApply(uint ui);
Convert uint to dword

union qword;
Allow for easy bool-by-bool conversion from one eight-byte type to another.

long l;
ulong ul;
double d;
float[2] f;
int[2] i;
uint[2] ui;
short[4] s;
ushort[4] us;
byte[8] b;
ubyte[8] ub;
char[8] c;
Union of various types.

bool almostEqual(float a, float b, float fudge = 0.0001F);
Check if two floats are almost equal, that is, they differ no more than fudge from one another, relatively speaking. If fudge is 0.0001 (the default) Then 10000 and 10001 will compare equally and so will 1.000 and 1.0001; but if either of those differ more, they are not considered equal. Also, numbers with an absolute difference less than or equal to fudge will always compare equal. This allows 0.00001 and 0 to be almost equal.

char[] absPath(char[] rel_path);
Given relative path rel_path, returns an absolute path.

T clamp(T)(T v, T lower, T upper);
Clamp v between l and u

char[] cleanPath(char[] path);
Resolve "../", "./", "//" and other redirections from any path. This function also ensures correct use of path separators for the current platform.

uint nextPow2(uint input);
Returns the first integer n such that 2^n >= input.

Example:
nextPow2(9); // returns 16

float map(float v, float oldmin, float oldmax, float newmin, float newmax);
Map a value from one range to another

T[0] max(T...)(T a);
Return the maximum of all arguments

T[0] min(T...)(T a);
Return the minimum of all arguments.

long getCPUCount();


void printBits(void* a);
Print out the bools that make a 32-bool number

float random(float min, float max);
Generate a random number between min and max.
